author: Odeinoichus
title: Knighton Army Building Fun
review:
Set #853515 Knight’s Army-Building Set: Again another fun little additional set for the Nexo Knights theme that offers up multiple knights to populate your collection with. This set is, in my opinion, slightly better than the Monster set simply because it includes a Nexo Power for your collection.

Packaging

The packaging is the same as discussed in the previous review, the difference being the artwork on the back of the card. This time there’s a large grassy field with a haunting looking castle barely visible in the distance, it’s shrouded in mystery and mist making for a very atmospheric looking image. Great choice for packaging here.

Minifigures

Nexo Knight Soldier: There are three ordinary soldiers in the set, two of which use the fully enclosed helmet piece and the other who uses the wide-brimmed style helmet with the open area to see the face.

All three of them have pretty much identical prints to the Royal Soldiers we’ve discussed in the other sets. Two share identical torsos and legs, even the heads are identical, while the other uses a different torso and leg combination. All three have the bulky armour piece, two in light blue the other in silver, making me think he’s meant to be the leader of the unit.

The pikeman uses a large pike weapon with a sword-blade attached to a dark blue lightsaber hilt as part of the weapon build.

The axe soldier holds an axe built with a dark blue lightsaber hilt, a standard grey space gun and the axe head piece with the clip.

The unit leader wields a sword and shield which houses a Nexo Power. All three look great and I just dig the fun blue colours used with all of these generic knights, it makes for a unique new look and really adds to the space knights idea behind the theme.

Squire Bot: This little guy is built using the same parts as the Lance Bot, the colours are different here of course and the helmet is the wide-brimmed sort. One thing these short torsos have as an issue is the stubby nature of the arms, it makes it impossible to have them stand at attention with their arms at their side for inspection because the thick hips and shoulder pads get in the way.

These little bots are still pretty fun though.

Whiplash Nexo Power: On a red translucent shield piece a large cracking whip is printed, considering none of these knights are using a whip this power seems a bit pointless, it’d be interesting if they had given the knight a whip instead of a sword.

Overall opinion

A great little army builder set and I wholly recommend it. If you can still find it I’m sure it’ll make a great addition to any collection of knights. I still feel the price is a bit high for four Minifigures though, most sets at this price range include at least close to 100 parts to build some kind of small vehicle, charging so much for just four Minifigures is a bit of a downer.
